basics.name: Felipe Arce
basics.label: FullStack Developer
basics.summary: Software Developer with 3 years of experience in Full-Stack web development and mobile applications. Expert in user flow optimization, SEO, and client-oriented applications.

positions.title: React Native Developer
positions.description: SQLite implementation in event access control app by roster (OurClub), enabling offline storage of attendee data and connectivity-free operation.

positions.title: React Native Developer
positions.description: Development of Notifications Notebook application for the Official Bulletin of students from Buenos Aires province schools (DGCYE), managing attendance, grades, and school trajectory.

positions.title: Frontend Developer
positions.description: Development of CRM for Gestión Seguros with React and Material UI, recording calls and client tracking.

positions.title: FullStack Developer
positions.description: Maintenance and development on legacy OurClub project with AngularJS and .NET 3.1.

positions.title: Frontend Developer
positions.description: Development of the frontend for a health platform, implementing UI design with HTML and CSS, optimizing code to improve performance, and collaborating with designers and backend to ensure a fluid and attractive user experience.

certificates.area: RH134 – Red Hat System Administration II (v10.0)
certificates.description: Currently studying RH134, deepening in RHEL system administration: shell scripting, regular expressions, task scheduling, storage management with LVM, firewall configuration, SELinux, boot process troubleshooting, system tuning, and container management.

certificates.area: RH124 – Red Hat System Administration I (v10.0)
certificates.description: During the RH124 course I gained experience in user management, permissions, storage, system processes, applying essential bash commands. Additionally, I incorporated task automation with scripts and problem solving, strengthening my foundation as a SysAdmin oriented to enterprise environments.

University Technical Programmer graduated from UTN. During the degree, I developed a personal project in Astro with React.js and TypeScript components for tracking my progress, achieving a 40% increase in visits in 2025. I worked with C# in .NET using WPF and deepened in SQL databases, applying good development practices.

Currently studying Level 3 of the CUI Extracurricular English Program at the Faculty of Agronomy (UBA). Strengthening the four main skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing, with a communicative approach in real-life contexts.

Course from the CUI Extracurricular English Program at the Faculty of Agronomy (UBA). I strengthened reading and listening comprehension skills, with emphasis on oral and written expression, prioritizing conversational practice in everyday situations.

I developed backend skills with Node.js and Express.js, implementing the MVC pattern and separation of responsibilities. I designed and managed databases in MongoDB, optimizing queries and structures, which resulted in a 25% improvement in performance and a 20% reduction in web application response times.
courses: Backend Programming with Node.js, Express and MongoDB

certificates.description: I started my career in web development with HTML and CSS, perfecting my DOM skills with JavaScript. I developed the interface of an e-commerce, improving code reusability by 30%. Then, I deepened in ReactJS, creating reusable components and managing states efficiently.
EFSET quick certificate that reflects my English level: B1 in reading and listening comprehension, and A2 in speaking.
Linux enthusiast sometimes I write mkdir, ls, pwd, and rm -rf. I use Fedora as my main distribution since 2022.

I have contributed in various job simulations, using Figma as the main tool for UX/UI design. I have created everything necessary to develop a web application and I feel comfortable working with Figma.

jobSimulations.description: I developed multiple MVPs for the No Country platform, taking on the Frontend role with React, Next.js and Tailwind, in collaborative projects of 4 weeks.

projects.name: Recipe web-blog
projects.description: I worked in a multidisciplinary team developing an MVP in React.js for a final project delivery. We implemented a recipe web-blog, allowing users to share, search and rate recipes.

projects.name: Book exchange platform
projects.description: We implemented a book exchange platform with a backend in NestJS and PostgreSQL, and a frontend in Next.js, ensuring scalability, security and a fluid user experience.
